a.xlink:title: Mozilla workflow chart. Graphviz dot source at http://k0s.org/mozilla/mozilla_workflow.gv.txt . Contact: jhammel@mozilla.com

Bugzilla is a defect tracking system to: track bugs and code changes; communicate with teammates; submit and review patches; and manage quality assurance. Each code change should be accompanied by a bug filed at bugzilla.mozilla.org
The Tinderbox Push Log organizes build + test results by changeset
Test harnesses run tests for regression, unit, integration, and performance
tests are written
Tests are written to ensure code that fixes a bug does not regress or cause performance issues.
The Mozilla Developer Center: Welcome to the Mozilla Developer Network!
wiki for mozilla users, using MediaWiki
The issue is developed in a copy of mozilla-central. This may be done in different ways, but many developers use patch queues optionally publishing them to the web.
issue is developed
issue is developed
When you want to land your code, but you donâ€™t have build/test/perf machines running locally to first verify your code is safe to land on every OS
patch is submitted
The patch is submitted to bugzilla with a review request
Mozilla mercurial repositories
finalized change is pushed
finalized change is pushed
patch is reviewed: r+/-

The patch is reviewed and given an r+ or an r-. For an r-, the developer must submit an additional patch that addresses the reviewers comments. For security and cross-module affecting patches, additional reviews may be required.
For each check-in, buildbot builds mozilla-central and tests are run with the built binary (continuous integration)
The tinderbox waterfall presents build and test data organized by time

Buildbot slaves that run tests. Test-running slaves are from a pool of machines that run and report on the results of different test harnesses on different platforms using the packaged builds + tests.
buildslaves build a packaged binaries and tests for the platforms of interest
source pulled
source pulled
Performance graphs from talos results
The sheriff is a person from the mozilla community is selected to watch over the build tree.
socorro collects crash reports
Litmus is the integrated manual testcase management and QA tool that is designed to improve workflow, visibility, and turnaround time in the Mozilla QA process.
